Trigonometric Calculus.name: Derivative of Sine Function
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The derivative of the sine function is the cosine function, reflecting the rate of change of sine.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Derivative of Cosine Function
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The derivative of the cosine function is the negative sine function.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Derivative of Tangent Function
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The derivative of the tangent function is the square of the secant function.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Derivative of Cotangent Function
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The derivative of the cotangent function is the negative square of the cosecant function.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Derivative of Secant Function
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The derivative of the secant function is the product of secant and tangent.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Derivative of Cosecant Function
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The derivative of the cosecant function is the negative product of cosecant and cotangent.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Product Rule with Trigonometric Functions
Trigonometric Calculus.description: Applies the product rule to differentiate products involving trigonometric functions.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Chain Rule with Trigonometric Functions
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The chain rule for composite trigonometric functions.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Indefinite Integral of Sine
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The antiderivative of the sine function is the negative cosine.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Indefinite Integral of Cosine
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The antiderivative of the cosine function is the sine function.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Indefinite Integral of Tangent
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The integral of tangent is the negative natural log of the absolute value of cosine.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Indefinite Integral of Secant
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The integral of secant involves the natural log of secant plus tangent.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Indefinite Integral of Cosecant
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The integral of cosecant is the negative natural log of cosecant plus cotangent.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Indefinite Integral of Cotangent
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The integral of cotangent is the natural log of the absolute value of sine.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Integration by Parts for Trigonometric Product
Trigonometric Calculus.description: Integration by parts is useful for products involving trigonometric functions.

example.solution:
\begin{aligned}
\text{Let } u = x, \ dv = \sin x \, dx \\
\text{Then } du = dx, \ v = \int \sin x \, dx = -\cos x \\
\int x \sin x \, dx &= uv - \int v \, du \\
&= x (-\cos x) - \int (-\cos x) \, dx \\
&= -x \cos x + \int \cos x \, dx \\
&= -x \cos x + \sin x + C
\end{aligned}

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Reduction Formula for Sine Powers
Trigonometric Calculus.formula: \int \sin^n x \, dx = -\frac{\sin^{n-1} x \cos x}{n} + \frac{n-1}{n} \int \sin^{n-2} x \, dx
Trigonometric Calculus.description: Reduction formula to simplify integrals of powers of sine.

example.solution:
\begin{aligned}
\text{Using reduction with } n=3: \\
\int \sin^3 x \, dx &= -\frac{\sin^{2} x \cos x}{3} + \frac{2}{3} \int \sin x \, dx \\
&= -\frac{\sin^{2} x \cos x}{3} + \frac{2}{3} (-\cos x) + C \\
&= -\frac{\sin^{2} x \cos x}{3} - \frac{2}{3} \cos x + C \\
&= -\frac{\cos x (\sin^2 x + 2)}{3} + C
\end{aligned}

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Second Derivative of Sine Function
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The second derivative of sine brings it back to negative sine, showing periodic differentiation.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Second Derivative of Cosine Function
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The second derivative of cosine returns negative cosine, showing periodic differentiation.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Definite Integral of Sine
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The area under the sine curve from 0 to \pi equals 2.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Definite Integral of Cosine
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The area under the cosine curve from 0 to \pi/2 equals 1.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Integral of Product of Sine and Cosine
Trigonometric Calculus.description: Using the substitution method, the product of sine and cosine integrates to half sine squared.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Integral of Sine Squared
Trigonometric Calculus.description: Using the power-reduction identity, the integral of sine squared is expressed in terms of linear and trigonometric functions.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Integral of Cosine Squared
Trigonometric Calculus.description: Using the power-reduction identity, the integral of cosine squared is expressed in terms of linear and trigonometric functions.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Derivative of Hyperbolic Sine
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The derivative of hyperbolic sine is hyperbolic cosine.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Derivative of Hyperbolic Cosine
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The derivative of hyperbolic cosine is hyperbolic sine.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Derivative of Hyperbolic Tangent
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The derivative of hyperbolic tangent is hyperbolic secant squared.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Derivative of Hyperbolic Cotangent
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The derivative of hyperbolic cotangent is negative hyperbolic cosecant squared.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Derivative of Hyperbolic Secant
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The derivative of hyperbolic secant is negative sech times tanh.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Derivative of Hyperbolic Cosecant
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The derivative of hyperbolic cosecant is negative csch times coth.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Integral of Hyperbolic Sine
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The antiderivative of hyperbolic sine is hyperbolic cosine.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Integral of Hyperbolic Cosine
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The antiderivative of hyperbolic cosine is hyperbolic sine.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Integral of Hyperbolic Tangent
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The integral of hyperbolic tangent is the natural log of hyperbolic cosine.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Integral of Hyperbolic Cotangent
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The integral of hyperbolic cotangent is the natural log of hyperbolic sine.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Integral of Hyperbolic Secant
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The integral of hyperbolic secant is the arctangent of hyperbolic sine.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Integral of Hyperbolic Cosecant
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The integral of hyperbolic cosecant is expressed in terms of natural log of hyperbolic tangent half-angle.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Derivative of Inverse Sine
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The derivative of arcsin is the reciprocal of the square root of (1 - x^2).

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Derivative of Inverse Cosine
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The derivative of arccos is the negative reciprocal of the square root of (1 - x^2).

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Derivative of Inverse Tangent
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The derivative of arctan is the reciprocal of (1 + x^2).

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Derivative of Inverse Cotangent
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The derivative of arccot is the negative reciprocal of (1 + x^2).

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Derivative of Inverse Secant
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The derivative of arcsec involves both |x| and the square root of (x^2 - 1).

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Derivative of Inverse Cosecant
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The derivative of arccsc is negative and involves both |x| and the square root of (x^2 - 1).

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Derivative of Inverse Hyperbolic Sine
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The derivative of arsinh is the reciprocal of the square root of (1 + x^2).

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Derivative of Inverse Hyperbolic Cosine
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The derivative of arcosh is the reciprocal of the square root of (x^2 - 1).

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Derivative of Inverse Hyperbolic Tangent
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The derivative of artanh is the reciprocal of (1 - x^2).

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Derivative of Inverse Hyperbolic Cotangent
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The derivative of arcoth is the reciprocal of (1 - x^2).

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Derivative of Inverse Hyperbolic Secant
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The derivative of arsech involves x in the denominator and the square root of (1-x^2).

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Derivative of Inverse Hyperbolic Cosecant
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The derivative of arcsch involves both |x| and the square root of (1 + x^2).

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Integral of Inverse Sine
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The integral of arcsin is computed using integration by parts.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Integral of Inverse Cosine
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The integral of arccos is found by applying integration by parts.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Integral of Inverse Tangent
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The integral of arctan is computed by parts, involving ln(1+x^2).

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Integral of Inverse Cotangent
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The integral of arccot involves ln(1+x^2) but with a positive sign compared to arctan.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Integral of Inverse Secant
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The integral of arcsec involves a logarithmic term with square roots.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Integral of Inverse Cosecant
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The integral of arccsc involves a logarithmic term similar to arcsec.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Integral of Inverse Hyperbolic Sine
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The integral of arsinh is obtained using integration by parts.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Integral of Inverse Hyperbolic Cosine
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The integral of arcosh involves the square root of (x^2 - 1).

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Integral of Inverse Hyperbolic Tangent
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The integral of artanh introduces a logarithmic term with (1-x^2).

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Integral of Inverse Hyperbolic Cotangent
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The integral of arcoth involves ln(x^2 - 1).

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Integral of Inverse Hyperbolic Secant
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The integral of arsech can be expressed with arcsin.

Trigonometric Calculus.name: Integral of Inverse Hyperbolic Cosecant
Trigonometric Calculus.formula: \int \operatorname{arcsch} x \, dx = x \, \operatorname{arcsch} x + \ln \left| x + \sqrt{1+x^2} \right| + C
Trigonometric Calculus.description: The integral of arcsch involves both arcsch and a logarithmic expression.
